title.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Nonproliferation Assistance Programs - Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund

description.narrative: Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund - Completion of BN-350; The Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund (NDF) provides a means for the USG to respond rapidly to high priority nonproliferation and disarmament opportunities, circumstances, or conditions that are unanticipated or unusually difficult. NDF projects aim to destroy, secure, or prevent the proliferation of WMD, WMD-related materials and delivery systems, and destabilizing conventional weapons.

description.narrative: In this project, the Kazakh Research Institute of Culture is teaming up with Indiana University and other U.S. institutions to investigate and interpret ancient Turkic runic writings found on manuscripts, carved monoliths, amulets, clay vessels, and other objects in Kazakh and other collections. Support for this project comes from the AFCP 20th Anniversary Partnership Program, a State Department special initiative.

title.narrative: Translation Interpretation Online Practicum

description.narrative: Translation Interpretation Online Practicum Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of State: Nonproliferation Assistance Programs - Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund

description.narrative: Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund - Global Activities; The Nonproliferation and Disarmament Fund (NDF) provides a means for the USG to respond rapidly to high priority nonproliferation and disarmament opportunities, circumstances, or conditions that are unanticipated or unusually difficult. NDF projects aim to destroy, secure, or prevent the proliferation of WMD, WMD-related materials and delivery systems, and destabilizing conventional weapons.

title.narrative: Together Against Human Trafficking

description.narrative: Kazakhstan is a source and destination country for men, women, and children subjected to sex trafficking and forced labor. The goal of this project is to increase access to justice for victims of human trafficking by building the organizational capacity of civil society organizations and the judicial system to combat trafficking in persons in Kazakhstan. Under the leadership of Sana Sezim, a local NGO based in Kazakhstan, the project will create a network of organizations across the country to collectively strengthen national trafficking legislation, conduct information campaigns, and provide legal assistance to victims of trafficking. If successful, this project will contribute to advancing the professionalism and empowerment of victim-service NGOs in Kazakhstan, which can be a critical partner to the government in the prevention of human trafficking, prosecution of traffickers, and protection of victims. A key priority of this project is to encourage the government of Kazakhstan to take ownership of providing direct services to victims of trafficking, so that this vulnerable population is no longer dependent on foreign assistance. If successful, the project also reduces the likelihood that human trafficking victims will be re-trafficked, increasing public safety in Kazakhstan and reducing the opportunity for exploitation of these victims in the hands of criminals.
